column4: Anyone availible to help w/ a problem involving "target filesystem doesn t have sbin init"?
what are you doing?
Lucid won't boot.  I found some info that suggests I could fix the prob via Live CD, but the Live CD doesn't get past the purple screen.
Here's a little more background - http://pastebin.com/J3XHemJe
okay so apparently your update was only partial. You can boot from some CD/USB chroot into your system and finish the update process
Sounds wonderful.  Can you help me w/ detail or point to a good tutorial for a 1st timer?
First ouy need to get a live system running. Apparently the CD you have fails? Can you boot into a console?
Before I ask what that means ... I typed in "help" after (initramfs), and I see "chroot" in the list of commands.  Is this a way to get where I need to be?
what means after initramfs? Can you boot your system?
Please see lines 31-33 of the pastebin link http://pastebin.com/J3XHemJe  - That's where I end up when the system fails to boot
what is strange is that it wants to mount dev to /root/dev which of course will fail
I typed it "chroot" and gave me - Usage: chroot NEWROOT [COMMAND...], Run COMMAND with root directory set to NEWROOT
just put the Live CD in another computer and confirmed that is works
That will not work as long as you haven't mounted everything to the correct place
so the CD works but not on the PC having the problems?
Correct.  Should we talk about booting into console?
Yes, when the CD boots press F6 and enter the boot paramter to contain: noquiet nosplash init=/bin/bash
F6 got me into Language
So if you have grub1 its Escape or Shift in Grub2 it's Escape and Shift
Esc gives me options of Try w/out install, check disc for defects, test mem, boot from first hard disk
Is that where I need to be?  I'm unclear as to my next step.
